1131658736869806080.text: Instead of rushing through billion-dollar spending bills at the eleventh hour without sufficient debate, Congress must start budgeting for natural disasters. That’s why I introduced a bill this week that would require disaster spending to be built into the annual budget process.

1131658735502405648.text: I promised the people of Utah that I would not be a rubber stamp for wasteful spending bills that drive up our already sky-rocketing national debt, and I cannot in good conscience support it.

1131658734168526848.text: It’s unfortunate that today’s spending bill, which was initially aimed at aiding Americans affected by natural disasters, has been loaded up with billions of dollars in unrelated pet projects—growing to over $19 billion in just the past few weeks.

1093006974856376320.text: While I welcome efforts by the administration to reach a political solution in Afghanistan and eliminate ISIS in Syria, I believe that – based on conditions on the ground – we must maintain a sufficient U.S. presence in both places to protect our national security interests.

1093006973862400000.text: When it comes to foreign policy, I have been encouraged by the administration’s decisions to support the people of Venezuela and take a hard line against Iranian aggression.

1093006972880855047.text: The Trump Administration deserves credit for working to cut taxes and regulations, which have helped boost our economy and raise wages.

1093006971760971778.text: He highlighted several critical policy areas where there are opportunities for both parties to work together – including lowering health care costs, reforming trade policies to better protect American workers, and strengthening border security and immigration enforcement.

1093006970888613888.text: The president’s speech was strong, well-delivered, and appealed to our patriotism and common values as Americans.
